About you: The company  Tecnolav Engineering s.r.l is a firm of highly competent engineering professionals with many years’ experience in the fields of planning and design in civil, industrial and infrastructural engineering projects. The firm has a proven track record of providing high-quality services while respecting schedules and costs. Over a hundred small, medium and large – and very often complex – projects have been successfully undertaken to date, reflecting our ethical values, passion and accumulated know-how.  This multidisciplinary approach serves as a guide to planning and design solutions leading to the choice of materials and proposals for innovative, often experimental, techniques which, by respecting safety measures and the environment, can contribute to growth in competitiveness and sustainability.    Quality, Environment, Safety and Social Responsibility  The company operates as a single, homogeneous unit secure in the knowledge that in today’s world only the combination of a group of professionals, each with their own expertise and specialized know-how, can provide the community with all-round services of the highest level.  Since its inception the company has conducted its affairs in strict accordance with specific internal procedures drawn up line with norm UNI EN ISO 9001. In June 2001, Tecnolav was awarded the Certification of Quality, subsequently extended to include Validation of Public Works projects in 2005.  In 2007, this Quality Certification was integrated with Environmental and Safety Certificates UNI EN 1401 and OH SAS 18001 respectively, and in the same year obtained the Certificate of Organizational Excellence.  In 2010, the company was awarded the certificate of ‘Corporate Social Responsibility’ in line with standard SA8000 and subsequently became a member of the Social Accountability Watch S.A.W., realizing the objectives set out in 2005 when the company adopted its own Ethical Code.    Associated activities  In March 2000, the company became a member of OICE (Association of Italian engineering and technical-economic consulting organizations), and in 2005 following a brief period with API (Small Businesses Association), the company became a member of the Association of Industrialists for the Province of Cagliari.  In 2010, Tecnolav became a member of the ‘Leonardo Consorzio’ - the Permanent Union of European Engineering Companies, which was established at the end of 2003.  A branch office in Sofia, Bulgaria has operated since 2001.  In 2013, company president Maurizio Boi became a member of AIIT ( National Association of Traffic and Transport Engineers).  Tecnolav is currently undertaking the procedures to become an “affiliate member “ of FIDIC.    Principle fields of activities  Tecnolav Engineering has gained expertise in the field of infrastructure design, in particular rail and road design. Our goal is to seek the most efficient, cost-effective, environmentally sustainable and design-worthy solutions to help people travel safely, quickly and comfortably. Tecnolav has designed the infrastructure for light rail systems for cities and towns as well as stations and intermodal hubs that not only serve users but integrate with their broader urban contexts. In accordance with our various quality certifications, Tecnolav seeks to optimise professional services in all phases of design and construction.  The company operates also in the following areas:  - designing and directing engineering projects of all kinds: civil and industrial construction work with relative installations, aqueducts, sewer systems, landscaping and decorative features;  - Project Management services (P.M.);  - Project Construction Management services (P.C.M.);  - Coordinating health and safety operations in the workplace from the planning and design stages to execution;  - verification for validation by local authorities  - planning, designing, executing, and directing support services for organizational and logistical;  - operations for commercial, tourist, and hotel complexes;  - mobility studies and road-rail transport planning;  - test runs and consultancies in testing and trials;  - consultancy services on matters of health and safety in the workplace.
